708677f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 40th Street
708677f-a.text:
Fifth Avenue, west side, north from 40th Street, showing portion
of old reservoir and Bristol Botel.
1897.
Ewing Galloway, Photographer.

708675f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 40th Street
708675f-a.text:
Fifth Avenue, west side, 42nd to 40th Street, showing old reservoir.
Site now occupied by New York Public Library.
1E98.
Brown Brothers, Photographer, copyright.
Sii4( ~129

708676f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 40th Street
708676f-a.text:
Fifth Avenue, west side, from 40th to 42nd Street, showing c
reservoir.
This was demolished in 1902 to be replaced by the New York P
Library.
Bristol Hotel, later converted into an. office building, stan
right background.
About 1897.
Elmendorf, Photographer;
copyrighted by Ewing Galloway.

712636f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street - 5th Avenue
712636f-a.text:
S.E. corner of Fifth Avenue and 40th Street, on present site of Arnold
Constable Department Store.
May 1909.
Ewing Galloway, Photographer.

708681f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 40th Street
708681f-a.text:
Fifth Avenue, at the S. W. corner of West 42nd Street, showing details of the New SSork Public Library plaza at this point. Buildings in the background are on the east side of the Avenue extending from 4ist (left) to 39th (right) St's. 4Oth Street is just behind the feminine figure shown.
About 1914
New York Edison Co., photo:
Gift of Gress (21 Nov. 1935)

712651f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712651f-a.text:
Excavating for the American Radiator Building, 38-44 West 40th Street, south side, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues.
July 10, 1923.
Peyser &. Patzig.

712652f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712652f-a.text:
Foundation work on the American Radiator Building, 38-44 West 40th Street, south side, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues.
July 23, 1923.
Peyser &. Patzig.

712653f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712653f-a.text:
Foundation work on the American Radiator Building, 38-44 West 40th Street, south side, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues.
July 23, 1923.
Peyser &. Patzig.

712654f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712654f-a.text:
Foundation work on the American Radiator Building, 38-44 West 40th Street, south side, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues.
August 6, 1923.
Peyser & Patzig.

712655f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712655f-a.text:
Foundation work on the American Radiator Building, 38-44 West 40th Street, south side, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues.
August 6, 1923.
Peyser & Patzig.

712656f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712656f-a.text:
Foundation work and shoring on the American Radiator Building. 38-44 West 40th Street, south side, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues.
August 20, 1923.
Peyser & Patzig.

712657f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712657f-a.text:
Foundation work and shoring for the American Radiator Building, 38-44 West 40th Street, south side, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues.
August 20, 1923.
Peyser &. Patzig.

712658f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712658f-a.text:
Start of construction work on the American Radiator Building, 38-44 Weat 40th Street, south side, between Fifth and Sixth
Avendes.
September 6, 1923.
Peyser & Patzig.

712659f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712659f-a.text:
Start of construction work on the American Radiator Building. 38-44 West 40th Street, south side, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues.
September 6, 1923.
Peyser & Patzig.

712660f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712660f-a.text:
Construction work on the American Radiator Building, 38-44 West 40th Street, south side, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues. 36 and 40-56 West 40th Street are also shown. 56 West 40th Street
at the right, is the Republican Club.
September 24, 1923.
Peyser & Patzig.

712661f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712661f-a.text:
Construction work on the American Radiator Building, 38-44 West 40th Street, south side, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues.
October 4, 1923.
Peyser & Patzig.

712662f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712662f-a.text:
Construction work on the American Radiator Building, 38-44 West 40th Street, south side, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues. The view is west along the south side of 40th Street from 32 West 40th Street. The building at the left is the Engineers' Club. The first building above the row of four-story buildings is the Republican Club.
October 18, 1923.
Peyser & Patzig.

712663f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712663f-a.text:
Construction work on the American Radiator Building, 38-44 West 4Oth Street, south side, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues. 36 and 40-56 West 4Oth Street are also shown. 56 West 40th Street
at the right, is the Republican Club.
September 24, 1923.
Peyser & Patzig.

712664f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712664f-a.text:
Construction work on the American Radiator Building, 38-44 West 40th Street, south side, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues. 54-46 and 36 to 2 West 40th Street are also shown. At the right is the Republican Club; in the centre, to the left of the American Radiator Building, is the Engineers' Club; and the next building beyond the
row of brownstones is the New York Club.
November 18, 1923.
Peyser &. Patzig.

712665f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712665f-a.text:
Construction of the American Radiator Building, 38-44 West 40th Street, south side, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues. 50-46 and 36-28 West 40th Street are also shown. At the left is the
Engineers' Club.
December 3, 1923.
Peyser &: Patzig.

712666f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712666f-a.text:
The American Radiator Building as it nears completion, 38-44 West 40th Street, south side, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues. The picture also shows 58-46 and 36-24 West 40th Street. At the right is the Republican Club, while just to the left of the American Radiator Building, separated from it by a single four-story building,
is the Engineers' Club.
December 18, 1923.
Peyser & Patzig.

712642f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712642f-a.text:
32, 3d, 40, 46, 48-52 Wiest 40th Street, south side, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues, with part of Bryant Park in the foreground. No. 40 is the newly completed American Radiator Building.
November, 1924.
P. L. Sperr.

712667f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712667f-a.text:
The American Radiator Building as it nears completion, 38-44 West 40th Street, south side, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues. The picture also shows 58-46 and 36 to 6 West 40th Street. At the right is the Republican Club; just to the left of centre is the Engineers' Club; while at the left, seen between the lamp post and tree, with a second tree obscuring its face, is the New York Club.
January 4, 1924.
Peyser & Patzig.

712668f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712668f-a.text:
The American Radiator Building as it nears completion, 38-44 West 40th Street, south side, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues, also showing 58-46 and 36 to 4 West 40th Street. At the right is the Republican Club; to the left of centre is the Engineers' Club; while below the latter, and separated from it by a row of brownstones, is
the New York Club.
January 14, 1924.
Peyser & Patzig.

712669f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712669f-a.text:
The American Radiator Building nearing completion, 38-44 West 40th Street, south side, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues, showing also 28-36 and 46-56 West 40th Street. At the left is the Engineers' Club, with its flag at half-staff in honor of former President Woodrow Wilson, who has just died. At the right, seen through the
bare branches of a tree, is the Republican Club.
February 9, 1924.
Peyser & Patzig.

712670f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712670f-a.text:
The American Radiator Building nearly completed, 38-44 Nest 40th Street, south side, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues. Also shown is 28-36 and 46-58 West 40th Street. The Engineers' Club is at the left, while the Republican Club is seen through the branches
of the tree in the right foreground.
February 27, 1924.
Peyser & Patzig.

712671f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712671f-a.text:
The American Radiator Building nearly completed, 38-44 West 40th Street, south side, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues, showing also 56-46 and 36-18 West 40th Street. The Republican Club is at the right and the New York Club at the left. Between the two is the
Engineers' Club.
March 6, 1924.
Peyser &. Patzig.

717896f-a.text:
Rear of Public Library,Fifth Avenue, west side, from 40th
42nd Streets, from Bryant Park.
Tall buildings, left to right, are: Chryaler, Lincoln, L
court Colonial, and 10 E. 40th Street.
About 1930.

708664f-a.text:

Fifth Ave., west side, south from, but not including West 40th Street. Note the construction at the site of the former Wendel House
(N.W. corner of West 39th Street).

708664f-b.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 40th Street
708664f-b.text:

708668f-a.text:

708717f-a.text:

712638f-a.text:
West 40th Street, south side, west from (Nos. 6-10), but not including Fifth to Sixth Aves., showing No. 12, (the former Kimball Building) under

April 16, 1937.
. L. Sperr.

712640f-a.title: Manhattan: 40th Street (West) - 5th Avenue
712640f-a.text:
11 West 40th Street, at the N.W. corner of Fifth Ave. (N.Y.P.L.), showing the W.P.A. constructing a new delivery and loading platform. No. 2 shows the side wall and windows that will be utilized for an entrance. The regular arched doorway is on the extreme right, but does not appear
in these scenes.
September 1937.
George D. Chinn.

712641f-a.text:
28 West 40th Street, south side, between Fifth and Sixth Aves.

36 West 40th Street, south side, between Fifth and Sixth Aves.

712650f-a.text:
Demolition work, 38-44 West 40th Street, south side, between Fifth and Sixth Avenues, to make way for the American Radiator Building. 36 and 46 West 40th Street are also shown.
June 5, 1923.
Peyser & Patzig.

708691f-a.text:
Fifth Avenue, west side, from 40th to 42nd Street. The New York Public Library occupies this site and is photographed from the rear. Fifth Avenue is beyond seme. W. 40th Street is on the right and 442nd Street on the left. Surrounding same are the towering structures comprising the Grand Central-42nd Street outline. Streets.

Fifth Avenue, on site of Bristol Hotel.
September 28, 1930.
P.L. Sperr,Photographer.

708698f-b.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 40th Street
708698f-b.text:
Fifth Avenue, west side, north from 40th Street (left), showing prominently the N. Y. P. L. to the south of 42nd Street. Above same is the towering office building, No. 500 Fifth Avenue (under construction). Views 1 and 2 are photograohed from atop the Arnold WWonstable building at the S. E. corner of 40th Street. No. 3 is westward on 41st Street to show the main entrance to the
LLibrary.
Views 1,2 August 4, 1930
P. L. Sperr
View 3 SSeptember 28, 1913

708703f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 40th Street
708703f-a.text:
(1)
Fifth Avenue, west side, from 40th to 42nd Street (The New York Public Library) as photographed from the office building, No. 500 Fifth Avenue. Bryant Park is in the rear; West 40th Street on the left; and Fifth Avenue on the right. Note the traffic on Fifth Avenue.
June 24, 1931
P. L. Sperr
(2)
The same, north from West 40th to 42nd Streets. This view shows the front of the New York Public Library and its promenade, which is elevated and set back from the sidewalk. Note in the background, the lower stories of No. 500 Fifth Avenue., at the N.W. corner of 42nd
Street.
October 2, 1936
P. L. Sperr

708706f-a.text:

708710f-b.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 40th Street
708710f-b.text:
Fifth Avenue, west side, from 40th to 42nd Streets, showing details of the new roofing at the N. Y. P. L. building. This was performed by the W. P. A. through the assistance of the City of New York. The new metal covering is "Monel" or a similar alloy and replaced a copper sheathing. The four views here are northward towards a background formed br W. 42nd Street and Fifth Avenue. Note the glimpse of the latter thoroughfare on the right
of one of these photos.
April 7, 1937
Views 1,2,3,4
W. P. A. photo
Five Boroughs Project

708714f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 40th Street
708714f-a.text:
Fifth Avenue (left), at the S.W. corner of West 42nd Street (rimht), showing the Central Building of the New York Public Library, occupying the west side of the Ave. from 4Oth to 42nd Streets. At the rear of same and extending to Sixth Ave., is Bryant Park, completing what was formerly the site of the Reservoir. This photograph, taken at 7 P.M., shows a southsestward view towards structures that surround this open area in Manhattan's heart. On the left, and partially cronped by the top margin is the huge Empire State Building at 34th
Street.
February 7, 1938.
Mr. Nathan Schwartz.
New York Public Library.

708715f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 40th Street
708715f-a.text:
Fifth Ave., west side, north from West 40th to 42nd Streets, showing the Central Building of the New York Public Library photographed at dusk (6:30 P.M.). The skyscrapers on the right are, the huge No.
500 Fifth Ave. Building and the Salmon Towers.
March 17, 1938.
Mr. Nathan Schwartz.
New York Public Library.

708718f.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 40th Street
708718f.text:
Fifth Avenue, west side, from W. 40th to 42nd Streets, showing
the New York Publie Library and esplanade.
1938-9
Alexander Alland
This photo is one of a series that appeared in the published volume "Portrait of New York' by Felix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland,IRGV.
Neg. ~ 392S

708721f.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 40th Street
708721f.text:
Fifth Avenue, west si de, from 41st to 42nd Street, showing the rain entrance to the New York Public Library, the north wing and the Esplanade as viewed from the side walk curb on the Avenue. To the right is a portion of the No. 500 - Fifth Avenue Building,
located at the N.W. corner of W. 42nd Street.
February 1939
Mr. Nathan Schwartz
New York Public Library

708722f.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 40th Street
708722f.text:
Fifth Avenue, west side, at 41st Street, showing the New York
Public Library and one of its watchful lions.
Winter 1939

708724f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 40th Street
708724f-a.text:
Fifth Avenue, west side, from 4oth to 42nd Streets, showing the N. Y. P. L. esplanade and main entrance. At the right is a portion of the towering office structure at the N. W. corner of 42nd Street. This is known as the No. 500 Fifth Ave. Bldg.
February 1940
George D. Chinn

708728f-a.title: Manhattan: 5th Avenue - 40th Street
708728f-a.text:
Fifth Avenue, west side, from 40th to 42nd Streets, showing the front of the New York Fublic
Library the morning wfter a snowstorm.
The view is northward on the esplanade frontage, with 42nd Street and its towering 500-Fifth Avenue Building on the right.
February 16, 1940
'Tathan Schwartz
New York Public Library
Photostat Division
